block.p: Seeking to consolidate Russia's hold on Chechnya, President Vladimir V. Putin appointed a Muslim cleric to govern the breakaway republic. The new leader is Mufti Akhmed Kadyrov, a Chechen who urged accommodation with Moscow after Russian troops intervened last year.

Seeking to consolidate Russia's hold on Chechnya, President Vladimir V. Putin appointed a Muslim cleric to govern the breakaway republic. The new leader is Mufti Akhmed Kadyrov, a Chechen who urged accommodation with Moscow after Russian troops intervened last year.

Many Chechens, however, resent leaders who have sided with the Russians, and it will be difficult for Mufti Kadyrov to establish control. Aslan Maskhadov, the president of Chechnya before the Russians intervened in 1994, has denounced the mufti as a traitor.
